intro: Zieridium, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Zieridium species are often found in rocky or sandy soils, and they play a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators. Their compact growth habit and vibrant blooms make them popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping.
